boardgame.name: Nova Luna: Scoresheet
boardgame.description: wipeable - abwischbares scoresheet handed out at Spielwiesn in Munich 2019

boardgame.name: Schnellen
boardgame.description:
Schnellen; is a trick taking game with trumps. It is a popular card game in the region of Tyrol, South Tyrol and Vorarlberg. It is played with a set of German-suited playing cards (33 cards) where the 6 Bell-card (Weli) is always trump color and the second highest value. Each player gests five cards and is predicting the number of tricks taken by himself. If you succeed you loose points, if you fail you gain points.
There are variants with exchange (bad) cards and leaving a round.

—user summary

boardgame.name: narramur (Nummer 1 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description: Issue #1 describes a framework for collaborative setting creation, story-telling and role-playing.

boardgame.name: Frontline Attack: War Over Europe
World War II: Panzer Claws
Вторая Мировая: Стальной Кулак
二战：装甲战车
boardgame.description:
From back of box
Take command of the Allied, German, or Soviet armies as you engage the enemy in the European theater of war. Utilize infantry, a vast number of tanks and other motorized vehicles, as well as air reinforcements to shift the balance of power and reach your ultimate objective... VICTORY!

FEATURES

Battle throught over 20 historic mussions from the German invasion of Soviet Union, to D-Day on the battlefields of World War II



Infiltrate defensive installations with ground troops, bombard the enemy with tanks and atrillety strikes, and call in air reinforcements



Strategeically plan your assault as weather conditions and time-of-day effects landscape appearance and the behaivor of your units



Command the German Wehrmacht, the Soviet Red Army, or the Allied Forces



Create your own theater of war for single player, multiplayer or skirmish battles with an easy-to-use map editior



Engage others in Internet or LAN multiplayer combat
boardgame.videogameversion: European/German Windows CD-ROM Premier Collection edition
European/German Windows CD-ROM Software Pyramide/Classic Edition edition

boardgame.name: World War II: Panzer Claws 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Successor to World War II: Panzer Claws

boardgame.name: World War II: Panzer Claws
World War II: Panzer Claws [compilation]
boardgame.description:
From back of box
Take command of the Allied, German, or Soviet armies as you engage the enemy in the European theater of war. Utilize infantry, a vast number of tanks and other motorized vehicles, as well as air reinforcements to shift the balance of power and reach your ultimate objective... VICTORY!

boardgame.name: Instant Iceland
boardgame.description:
A trivia card game with questions related to Iceland in three categories; history, land and nature, people and culture. Players can choose two ways to play, ie. On The Road where they discard cards or Go Fish to collect cards, both times when players answer correctly.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Frægð og frami
boardgame.description:
Frægð og frami (Fame and Glory) is a party game where players take on the role of an influencer who competes with his opponents to be the first one to gain 20 thousand followers. Each round player roll a die to move their pawn around the board and act as the spaces indicate, if needed. This gives the players the chance to add fame and glory cards to their hands, defend from attacks, add or lose followers and so on. When all players have rolled the Spotlight starts which is the task the influencers have to deal with. What does one not do to gain fame and glory?

—user summary

boardgame.name: Orða
boardgame.description:
Players describe the key word without using the five forbidden words on the card, in one minute. Those who guess correctly get the card (a medal) while the president (current player) gets as many cards (medals) from the back of the box. After everyone has been president the one with most medals wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bankman
boardgame.description:
Feel yourself in the role of the tycoon of the financial world of the early twentieth century! Trade with partners, buy enterprises, unite them into trusts and corporations! To win, develop strategic thinking, cunning, but most importantly - the flexibility of the mind and the ability to negotiate.

A great game for both a family vacation and a fun company from 2 to 12 people!

—description from publisher

On their turn, players can buy one enterprise from the market by paying a certain combination of different currency cards. Players can exchange currencies among themselves to collect the desired combination. The goal of the game is to collect as many business cards from one industry as possible. The game ends when the market runs out of all company cards and then the players count the points for the cards they have purchased. Each enterprise card brings a certain number of points to its owner, but if he has several cards of the same industry, then the points brought by enterprises in this industry are higher, and if the player has collected all the cards of one industrial branch, he receives the largest possible number of points from these enterprise cards for Monopoly.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Small Farmer
boardgame.description:
Grow the vegetables, raise the sale price, and make a fortune!

Small Farmer is a simple card game about vegetable economics. Each round, a number of cards (player number + 1) will be displayed on the table. Each card has 3 vegetable icons on it (a combination of 1 to 5 types of vegetables). Players take turns to choose one of the cards to put into their harvest pile facedown. The last card that was not chosen will determine which vegetables' prices will go up. If the price goes over 6, it will drop down to 1 and cycle up again.

After 6 rounds, you will count your scores by multiply the amount of each vegetable you have harvested with the final price of that vegetable. The player with the highest score wins!

boardgame.name: Morph
boardgame.description:
Morph is a simple but challenging set collection, pattern matching game with the goal of being the first player to create a number of sets of 3 cards with the same shape. To do this, you must morph your hand by matching a card by color or shape with a card on the table. If you matched a card by color, you must match said card to a second one by shape, and viceversa.

—description from the designer

AWARDS
3rd place Best Solo Game in the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest
Additionally:
5th place Best Game Using Only Cards
9th place Best Overall Game

boardgame.name: Casio MX-10
Casio MX-101
Casio MX-15
boardgame.description:
User Summary

MSX-1 system:

The successor of Casio PV-16; houses 16 kB of RAM and 16 kB VRAM.

The MX-10 was aimed for the Japanese market and was sold in red or black and could be used with the Casio KB-10 expansion unit.

An expanded version with antennas were sold as MX-101

Internationally the MX-10 was sold as MX-15, with QWERTY keyboard; the Thai version had a sticker with Thai letters on top of the row of keys.
boardgame.videogamehwmfg: Casio (カシオ計算機株式会社)

boardgame.name: War for Chicken Island: The Cackle of Cluckthulhu
boardgame.description:
Chicken Island has been immersed in war for years now. Seeking for new powers in places where no chicken was meant to go, a new threat rises: The Cult of Cluckthulhu. Silent wanderers are called to a profane celebration. Their goal: to invoke unthinkable horrors out of this world or any other! Now, the Leaders of the chicken army must become Chickenstigators to fight together this dread terror or perish in darkness.

The Cackle of Cluckthulhu is a cooperative scenario for War For Chicken Island for 1 to 4 players.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

listing.notes:
Kickstarter Extra. Includes miniature, rules to play with War for Chicken Island and cards. Fun oversized miniature for other random boss encounters in RPG games too.
Canadian Residents - local sales tax will be added.
Shipping - $10 ON/QC, $14 AB/BC/MB/SK/NS/NB, $17 NL/PEI, $20 everywhere else in Canada & continental US Local Pick Up available in Toronto ON

boardgame.name: Incredible Voyages: Undersea Combat in the Victorian Age
boardgame.description:
Enter the world of Incredible Voyages, Long Face Games’s fast play set of Victorian science fiction submarine rules. Where the undersea navies of the world’s Great Powers fight amongst themselves – and with anarchists, criminal gangs and evil arch-scientists for supremacy in a secret undersea war.

The rules are based on David Manley’s popular and successful “Stingray” game adapted and greatly expanded to cover the Victorian era.
The rules use a hex movement system, but “free movement” rules are also included for those that don’t like hexes.

Use whatever models you want, go wild with your scratchbuilding, or download free 3D printing files online.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pipsa Possu: Kuralätäkkö
boardgame.description:
It's time for a mudbath! Drop Peppa into the puddle and try to splash mud on characters around the puddle. You will get a prize token for every succesful splash. First to splash mud on every character is the winner of the game!

Includes a challenging game for more experienced gamers.

boardgame.name: Szabadulj kvíz
boardgame.description: Players admire the pyramids on the Mokattam Plateau in Egypt. When entering the great pyramid of Giza, a scary thing happens. The stone slab blocking the entrance to the pyramid closes with a huge bang. Whoever wants to get out of the captivity of the pyramid must answer the questions correctly. The cards feature questions from players on a variety of topics: science, technology, flora and fauna, literature, cinema, and the fine arts. Whoever answers the question correctly can move with his piece as many squares on the pyramid fields as the question card gives. Within the pyramid, you can move in any direction through the corridors, but you must not cross the walls and doors. The doors can only be crossed by answering a door opener card, but it is by no means certain that the door will be open and allow the adventurer to pass. When a player gives a correct answer to a door opener question, the door is revealed and you will know whether that door is open in any direction or if it has been blocked for a long time by a stone collapse. With the Szabadulj kvíz game, everyone can have fun, gain new knowledge, test their knowledge and learn many interesting things!

boardgame.name: Pigskin Pantheon
boardgame.description:
Hello and welcome, owners, to the genesis of a new league. An exciting and surprising evolution of football awaits. You will all take part in the making of great sports franchises over many seasons. Compete with other owners by drafting, trading, equipping, and improving your team. Who will rise to the top of the pantheon? Only time will tell!

Pigskin Pantheon is a 1-4 player football management card game. Sign players ranging from chicken men, werewolves, sentient shovels, and even a dog on a skateboard. Combine players with gear and accolades to dominate on game day. If you're into it, sabotage opposing teams with scandals, gruesome injuries, and poaching rival players!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Route-Finder: Intercontinental
boardgame.description:
It's the 1920s, and before these new airlines people are talking about can start flying around the world, the routes the aeroplanes will fly have to be mapped out and tested. As a daring pilot, you want to be the first, you want to set the record for the fastest flight between two cities, to be known as the Route-Finder — and the most challenging flights are intercontinentals: London to Melbourne, London to Wellington, or Tokyo to Rome.

But, if you're going to win fame and (perhaps) fortune, you need to be a careful planner and a dedicated engineer. Your aeroplane will have limited performance, so your route must be carefully chosen, and your aeroplane design well thought out to complete the route as quickly as possible. Before getting stuck into the fun stuff, you need to find the funding to support your flight – you think it’s a great idea, but how many others do? Luckily, it’s a time of great interest in flight and pilots, so finding some funding shouldn’t be a problem. Finding enough funding, though – that’s tricky. And then, Mother Nature awaits. Will she look kindly on your route-finding flight?

Game play in Route-Finder: Intercontinental involves using 2D6 and look up tables to find your sponsors and Finance, which allows you to buy the parts for your aeroplane. Choosing these depends on the route you intend to fly - will it be land or water based, short or long hops? But you need to track how much Finance you've used - you'll need a lot during the flight for refuelling, repairs, etc. Once your aeroplane's ready to go, your flight is a series of flight legs and city stopovers, with your aeroplanes technologies and 2D6 rolls and look up tables determining what happens during each. If you manage your Finance right, keep your aeroplane in good order, and choose your Route wisely, you might just find your Route.

Multi-player mode can be co-operative or competitive. Several players can play as different members of the same crew, each bringing different strengths to the challenge, and sharing in the decision making. Or each player could fly their own aeroplane, the pilot who arrives in the least number of Days being the winner.

boardgame.name: Salvage Op
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Salvage Op is a short adventure for The Expanse Roleplaying Game intended for a crew of four to six 1st to 3rd level characters. The characters encounter a small ship floating dead in space. Salvaging the ship’s cargo could be an opportunity for riches, but what danger awaits onboard? What happened to the crew, and why is it here? This adventure works well as a one-shot or can be easily inserted into an existing campaign.

boardgame.name: Felicitas Fogg: In 80 Karten um die Welt
boardgame.description:
Felicitas Fogg is a point-to-point movement bidding game with augmented reality (AR) support, where players have to select vehicles from their hand to move the character Felicitas Fogg on her trip around the world or discard them from their hand to restore energy and draw two new cards. The vehicles have different values for range, energy consumption and data traces. The values are modified by events like weather effects and individual player abilities. Felicitas always chooses the vehicle with the highest maximal range and the player winning the bid gains victory points depending on the number of fields she travelled. However, a hacker from F1X collective chases her, so the players are forced to leave as few traces of data as possible. At each location switch, the chaser makes an attractive offer and players may individually choose to help him. But whenever he catches Felicitas, all players lose the game.

Felicitas Fogg has been published by the organization Deutschland sicher im Netz (Germany safe in on the Internet) and is sponsored by the German Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Deutschland sicher im Netz e. V.

boardgame.name: Darkest Stars (Issue 1 - April 2020)
boardgame.description:
from the editor

Before you are the first fruits several years of thought and writing. If you read my blog, Den of the Lizard King, some of this may be familiar to you. But now, thoroughly edited, I offer you these articles in fanzine format, easy to print and read. From general musings about Classic Traveller itself, to the Dark Nebula itself, to new and clarified rules – I hope that you will find this issue useful, interesting, and entertaining.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: On the Beauty of Classic Traveller
Quick and Dirty Classic Traveller Vehicle Combat
A Short History of the Dark Nebula

boardgame.name: Darkest Stars (Issue 2 - June 2020)
boardgame.description:
from the editor

To my great pleasure and gratefulness, this fanzine’s initial publication was met with far more enthusiasm and love from the Traveller community. Several people stepped up and volunteered their own work for this fanzine – which I gladly accepted and added to these pages.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: In Defense of Dying in Classic Traveller Character Generation
Variant Rules: Mobs, Grunts, and Monsters

boardgame.name: Call of Duty: Warzone
boardgame.description:
A free to play battle royale add-on for Call of Duty Modern Warfare; the game is a part of the 2019 title Call of Duty: Modern Warfare but does not require purchase of it

The game features two main modes: Plunder and Battle Royale. Warzone introduces a new in-game currency system called "Cash" which is used at "Buy Stations" in and around Verdansk. "Loadout" drops are an example of where Cash can be traded for limited access to players' custom classes (which were shared with Modern Warfare's standard modes prior to Season 6, v1.29, but now are unique to Warzone).
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2021 The Game Awards Best Ongoing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Food Truck Champion: Crabs! Promos
boardgame.description:
Five new promo cards for Food Truck Champion originally included with the Crabs! Kickstarter Edition.

These crab themed cards are shuffled with the 95 game cards from the base game to augment that deck. The cards play by the same rules as those from the base game, providing some new combinations of roles, recipes, and ingredients.

boardgame.name: Tetris Shake
boardgame.description: Players take turns stacking their tetris pieces on a shaking base. Whenever pieces fall off, the player has to take them. The first player that has placed all their pieces, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Meme vs 100cia
boardgame.description:
Meme vs 100cia (Meme vs Science) is a fast card game, when every player represents a Scientist who must get 3 stars to win.

There are 2 decks: the Menace deck (memes and videos randomly displayed on the table); and Troll deck (cards in hand).

Every turn, you use your Troll cards to defeat Menace cards and get stars. You can seduce Menace cards instead, to get bonus effects.

Each Troll card can be discarded any moment, to get a special and unique power.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Meme vs 100cia: CEO Ludoty promo card

boardgame.name: Den of Thieves
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In order to play Den of Thieves you need a scenario deck and some protagonist characters. You can use a normal deck of 52 playing cards if you want to use the scenario deck included in this document. Protagonists are fantasy thieves in a fantasy city, and the rules for creating them are given later.

During the game, each player takes on one or more roles. There must always be one dealer, one antagonist, and one or more protagonists. Anyone who is playing but not as one of these three roles makes up the audience until they take on a role.

boardgame.name: Thieves Can Too, Motherf***er!
Thieves Can Too, Motherfucker!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Unless you are the GM, you need a character. Choose one from the list of famous thieves. The GM can assign the remaining names to the supporting cast. Names are disguises as often as they are descriptive nicknames, so any name can be used by both men and women. Often, when one thief is done with a name, some other thief will adopt it.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Monolith
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Beneath the Monolith is a 5E campaign
setting based on the groundbreaking, award-winning, far-future setting known as the Ninth World, first presented in the standalone hardcover, Numenera.

User summary:

This is intended for use with Arcana of the Ancients

boardgame.name: Of Silence & Shadow: A Dark Fantasy Skirmish Wargame
boardgame.description:
Of Silence & Shadow is a skirmish wargame set in the realms of dark fantasy.

What is a skirmish wargame?
A skirmish wargame is a type of wargame that uses relatively few figures compared to larger more boastful wargame battles. Skirmish wargames focus on individual models and their abilities, rather than large units of soldiers.
In this game, each unit moves, acts, and fights on its own.

Dark fantasy is a type of fantasy where horror trumps the majestic.
Where fire spells burn their casters and getting sliced by a sword causes more injury than just a few hit points.
So, frame your mind around the darkest parts of fantasy, where life is horrific, knights do not always save the day, and princesses may be monsters in disguise.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: An Anthology of Cozy RPGs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of seven tiny RPG games designed during short breaks and bus rides within a single week. The rules of each game have less than 200 words, making them very light and easy to play. These games were carefully designed, but still remain untested. Feel free to tweak the rules to make them more enjoyable.

boardgame.name: 18SJ: Railways in the Frozen North
boardgame.description: 18SJ is a game in the 18xx-series set in the United Kingdoms of Sweden and Norway and pits two to six players as investors in railroad corporations in the formative years of Nordic railways. It features a simple mechanism for the nationalisation of public corporations and simulates the construction of the mainlines of Swedish rail. The nationalisation means that each game will be completed with a varying number of corporations ultimately available. Shareholders need to be careful in stock investment and the timing of train purchases to maximize personal profit.

boardgame.name: Sweat, Tears, Blood
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A snappy, tense game about murdering the people you loved most.

boardgame.name: Charcuterie Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of disparate little roleplaying games
...
This is a collection of games I initially wrote and published in the last three months of 2019, which I then rewrote and fixed up.
boardgame.rpg: The Devil's After Both of Us

boardgame.name: Ekphrasis: A Practical Handbook for Practical Bards
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

This pocket guide from the Bardic College of the North is designed to disseminate information that Ivory Towers academics from the schools of wizardry have known for centuries but have failed to effectively communicate to the public: There are spirits trapped within every portrait and statue that are created on this planet.

Within the pages of this guide, you will be gifted with a survey of theories surrounding this phenomenon and a four-step guide on how to perform a ritual that can grant these spirits freedom.


Ekphrasis is a solo poetry writing game.
boardgame.rpg: Ekphrasis: A Practical Handbook for Practical Bards

boardgame.name: 200 Word RPG Challenge 2019
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The 200 Word RPG Challenge 2019 anthology collects all of the games and contest for the 200 Word RPG Challenge, 2019, information into a single document.
boardgame.rpg: Hey, this song reminds me of you
Man is the Warmest Place to Be
You're Gonna Carry Them With You

boardgame.name: Starport City Drop In Spots
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The galaxy is full of numerous starport cities sprawling with an endless array of businesses and other locations. Fleshing out the details of even one starport city map can be overwhelming at times. Here’s where this 30 sider roller comes in. In addition to knocking the dust off of that neglected thirty sided die you get a bunch of interesting locations to connect to those empty buildings on your starport city map. Some locations are seedy, others a common experience in any type of spaceport community. Name, random amount of occupants at the site (when the adventurers arrive), and details provided.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 33
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: The Ragged Fringe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The irregular border between the Crow Wood, a forest filled with towering poplars, elms, and maples, and the Green Scrabble, an expanse of dry grasslands and scrub, defines this territory. Two factions occupy the Ragged Fringe. Grass Clan hobgoblins maintain Camp Iron Watch in the Green Scrabble. They face off against competing hobgoblin tribes from nearby territories at the Field of Broken Bone. Their nearest neighbors, Black Feather Tribe kobolds, live in the forest at Pale Leaf. Edgeline Road runs along the fringe of the Crow Wood and serves as an oft-contested territorial border. Civilized folk seldom use the road, but it does pass by the area's sole attraction, the Giant's Cairn. Both hobgoblins and kobolds avoid the southern part of the region, the home of a dangerous predator.

boardgame.name: The Majestic Fantasy RPG, Basic Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A set of rules for creating and advancing characters from level 1 to 5. Has the Burglar, Cleric of Mitra, Fighter, and Magic User classes, plus backgrounds, combat rules, equipment, and spells. For the referee there are lists of monsters, NPCs, and magic items suitable to challenge and reward your players during a campaign. These rules feature abilities for use for when character do things outside of combat and spellcasting. Along with advice for referees on how to use the available mechanics to craft rulings. Finally, a basic overview of how to bring the world outside of the dungeon to life is provided.

boardgame.name: 100 Things Overheard in a 1920s Speakeasy - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Speakeasy is a term for an illegal bar or restaurant that sold alcohol between 1920 and 1933 (the time of prohibition). The speakeasy helped to change the United States by ushering in the notion of dating, mixing the races and sexes over drinks, and a new sense of lawlessness into the country. Many cities had thousands of speakeasies during prohibition.

boardgame.name: 100 Things in 19th Century Cowboy's Saddlebag
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cowboys (and cowgirls) can cover a large amount of territory as they watch over the land they’re attached to, or in pursuit of some elusive prize or opponent. Whether they are purely noble or more mercenary in nature, the fact remains that the Wild West is essentially just that - wild. And few will travel across it without practical weapons, tools, resources, supplies, and inspirational words of wisdom.

boardgame.name: 50 Warning Signs of Cyberpsychosis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cyberpsychosis is a mental disease which can cause personality fragmentation and bursts of irrational violence. Since everyone is unique, we need to accept that this fragmentation can be subtle and that we cannot pretend that the non-violent are immune to mental disturbances. Common signs are delusions, aversions, blackouts (similar to sleepwalking), and hallucinations.

boardgame.name: Forthright Open Roleplay Toolbox
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Unlimited Power!

With this supplement for Forthright Open Roleplay, your game can reach new heights of story and strategy! This book contains:


ALL THE BOOSTS: Hundreds of new Boosts!
Full explanations for creating your own Boosts IN CASE WE FORGOT ANY!
BOOST SYNERGY: Take two unrelated Boosts and unlock new powers for your character!
BOOST TAGGING: Customize Boosts even further by giving them tags that align them with your Gamescape!
BURDENS: With great power comes a terrible price!
New approaches to CHECKS AND BOONS!
New FIGHTING STANCES, PERSONAS, and SKILLSETS!
New options for VEHICLE COMBAT and MASS COMBAT!
HORROR and CORRUPTION rules to drive you mad!
MIND CONTROL POWERS to test your will!
PLACES OF POWER and OBJECTS OF LEGEND to feed your glory!
SHAPESHIFT into your enemies' worst nightmares!
GENRE guidance to use all these options to customize your own Gamescapes!


Transform your character into whatever you imagine! Once you have this book in your hands, players will have tough choices to make on which incredible abilities they want, and Guides will have fresh options for limitless new villainy.

boardgame.name: Binomial
언더워터 항해기
boardgame.description:
Binomial is a logic card game where players aim to get maximum victory points. Unlike russian loto or bingo, players decide for themselves which numbers to create (in the first phase of game) and for what postulate to use them (in the second phase of game).

So Binomial has two phases. In first, the first player rolls dice 16 times, and from received 16 numerics players create numbers secretly from each other. Then players reveal up to 16 cards from the deck and choose most appropriate numbers from their own for announced postulates on cards. The game ends either when all 16 postulates are revealed, or when at least one player uses all of his numbers. The player with the most victory points is winner!

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Holy Tokens Realistic Food Tokens
boardgame.description:
Set of 103 miniatures.

The package includes:
Fish - 21 pcs.
Fruits - 19 pcs.
Rodents - 21 pcs.
Grains - 21 pcs.
Invertebrates - 21 pcs.

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Chris, Leader of the Hunters
boardgame.description:
The 2019 Event Exclusive for The Walking Dead is Chris, leader of the Hunters. Under Chris’ leadership, the Hunters have survived the horror of the new world by hunting the easiest prey — humans.

The 2019 The Walking Dead: All Out War Event Exclusive includes:

1 plastic miniature,
2 resin objectives
Chris Survivor Card
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: All Out War
The Walking Dead: All Out War Collector's Edition

boardgame.name: Memory Kings: Extra Seasons Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Featuring 4 entirely new sets of cards, this expansion adds the Harvest, Fishing, Hunting, and Plague Seasons to your game, allowing an even larger play grid, or different colors selection.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Witch Queen
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Tomb Discovered!
News has got out about a tomb of unknown origin that has been found in the wilds. The explorer sent members of their expedition to alert the city authorities. That was two days ago, and there has been no sighting or word from them since.

This exciting 5th edition adventure contains:

4 levels of tomb-raiding action
Challenges and encounters designed for low (1-4), mid (4-8) and high (9-12) level adventurers.
Treasure and rewards based on the player’s daring
3 unique magical items and unique magical trinkets
Many traps to scare and ensnare adventurers
2 unique encounters with formidable undead foes
The Witch’s Labyrinth, where the players take turns to test each other!

boardgame.name: Umringt von Freunden
boardgame.description:
(from the back of the book)
The Serpent People, the renegade high priest Sha-Ytosh and the Great Old Yig himself offer a scaly panopticon of horror in this three-part campaign, which can be played on its own as well as the official final of Feind meines Feindes[/thing]!
Again the interests of various groups clash and the investigators are spoiled for choice as to whom they want to win as friend or enemy.

The adventure Drei Orte und viele Todesfälle (Three Places and Many Deaths) takes up the fact that the investigators may have joined very different parties and lets them verbally and effectively represent their interests in three very different locations in Germany, aggressively or defensively.

Then Nebel des Krieges (The Fog Of War) leads to Morocco - via the pulsating city of Tangar deep into the desert, where rebels and colonial troops face each other mercilessly and many a false snake behind the scenes holds the strings in their hands.

Finally, in Auf Orpheus'Spuren (In Orpheus' Footsteps), the path literally leads to the underworld - to the terrible land of Yoth deep below the surface of the earth!

And always there is the truth saying: With friends like these, who needs enemies ...

boardgame.name: Das grausame Reich Tsan Chan
boardgame.description:
(from the back of the book)
The liberated Great Old Ones will teach people new ways to scream and kill, to exult and have fun. And the entire earth will be aflame in a purgatory of ecstasy and freedom!
In the year 5000 the earth is a hell flooded by cosmic horror. The last civilized people live behind the protective walls of the cruel kingdom of Tsan Chan and have found a way to adapt to the situation and to form unholy alliances. This bizarre world is described in detail.
The "Stillwater Rapids" adventure (with pre-designed investigators) offers the ideal introduction to the distant future, when cruelty and madness reign over the earth.

(additional information)
This is a translation of The Cruel Empire of Tsan Chan[/thing] with an additional, new adventure

boardgame.name: Prokhorovka!
boardgame.description: Simulate the legendary tank battle of Prokhorovka for the first time in a 1 to 1 fashion (every single tank, every single squad ...) on the real terrain, obtained from the original Lutwaffe air recon images! This Advancing Fire game is also playable with the simple Starter Kit rules! The game has been revised by historian Cristopher A. Lawrence, author of Kursk: The Battle of Prokhorovka.

listing.notes: New copy in shrink.

Shipping $17 USPS Priority
Advancing Fires Prokhorovka!, new/mint, in original shrink. Pics are of actual item for sale.
If interested in multiple games, contact me for a shipping price quote. It should always be less than the total of the separate shipping charges, and sometimes considerably less.

boardgame.name: Maxim Gorki: The Siege of Sevastopol 1942
boardgame.description:
This is Critical Hit's module in ASL-compatible format for the battles in the area of the Maxim Gorki defence works at Sevastopol in 1942. The defences consisted of two 300mm twin gun turrets, together with supporting defences and an observation post all set on high ground with excellent fields of fire, and were intended to be a tough nut to crack. This is what the Germans had to attack in 1942 in order to capture Sevastopol and ultimately the whole of Crimea.

As a module, it is not a complete game in itself but requires ownership of the Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) rulebook and Beyond Valor module as a minimum. However, it is a very distinctive module with rules for previously-omitted areas such as fighting in the underground bunker complexes and with a map that makes you understand the size of the challenge to take on a well-prepared defence - these go beyond what is normally seen in ASL.

There are 12 scenarios ranging from small engagements to larger battles which will enable players to experience the struggle whilst attempting to capture (or defend) a significant fortification.

boardgame.name: The Romulan Star Empire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This unofficial sourcebook is designed to support Star Trek Adventures campaigns set within the Romulan Star Empire. It includes a brief overview of Romulan history, an Empire-specific Lifepath for players, Romulan Spaceframes, Special Romulan Ship Talents, and even a short Mission Brief to get you started with roleplaying as a member of the Empire.

boardgame.name: OneDice Hacks #1: Stunting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alternative rules and concepts for the OneDice game by Cakebread & Walton. This emphasis of this PDF release is on the fantasy and urban fantasy environments, although the hacks are fully compatible with other OneDice games. Written by Marco Ricco and art by Silvia Pilvius Masci.

boardgame.name: Lokil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghelspad is a massive and diverse land. Once a paradise, this continent is now scarred by the ravages of the Titanswar. In the wake of divine bloodshed, and beset on all sides by titanspawn, the people of Ghelspad survive and thrive on this befouled continent. Vigil Watch explores six different locations across Ghelspad.

From the bloody shores of the Toe Islands in the east to the Sweltering Plains of the west, Vigil Watch provides an in-depth look at a variety of locales and cultures.

Vigil Watch Part Six details the Library of Lokil, home to one of the greatest collections of lore and dangerous secrets in the Scarred Lands!

boardgame.name: Escape From Site 19
boardgame.description:
The largest base of the SCP Foundation has fallen. Its strict security measures, designed to keep paranormal objects at bay, have failed.

Consequently, artifacts, entities, and phenomena beyond human understanding, recovered from all over the world, are no longer protected. Or contained.

Escape from Site 19 takes place in the world of the SCP Foundation. A secret organisation dedicated to containing paranormal entities that would otherwise threaten human life and our perceptions of reality. If you want to survive, you must find a way to escape this place, where only a select few enter and even fewer leave. There will be unexpected challenges, unfamiliar enemies, and experiences you will never forget.
This game offers a unique playing experience. Every player takes on the role of one of twenty-six characters, each of them has distinct individual traits and a special ability.

Game participants do not compete against one an another, but rather work together as team members to beat the game. As survivors of the containment breach at Site 19, each team member must move along the game board to complete his escape.
Along the way, the team draws cards featuring the escaped anomalous objects, the SCPs. The cards reveal physical and mental tasks. At first, the tasks are relatively straightforward, but as the game progresses, they become increasingly difficult, requiring trust and teamwork. Throughout the game, every team member will face challenges and share his stories.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Escape From Site 19: GoI Scented Candles Set
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Extreme Board Games, s. r. o.

boardgame.name: Photoshoot
포토제닉
boardgame.description:
Your team of photographers have been hired to do a photoshoot of a group of celebrities. Their time is precious, and these celebrities will not let themselves be easily placed! Be quick and meticulous to become the best team of photographers.

In turns, two teams must complete the most photograph objectives during a limited amount of time. In order to do so, all players of a team will, in turn, swap Character tiles without consulting each other. During the game, they must follow the conditions imposed by the celebrities under the inflexible eye of the opposite team.

boardgame.name: Altiplano: Geekup Bag Set
boardgame.description: A set of five, microfiber drawstring bags for use with the game Altiplano. Each bag measures 17x20cm and is used as drawbags to replace the black fabric ones found in the box. Each bag features the llama from the cover of the Altiplano game box and is tinted to each player color.

boardgame.name: Royal Secrets
boardgame.description:
In Royal Secrets, you play as a spy of a foreign power in the French court. Your goal is to cunningly influence the decisions of the realm in favor of your country. For that purpose, you will have to send your team of allied courtiers to audiences with the king and queen where only the most influential will be heard. You will be forced to bluff but also to pool resources with your opponents. But only the most cunning will win.

The game is played in 7 rounds corresponding to the 7 audiences to which players will send Courtiers and Valets (cards in their hands) in order to influence the king and queen and gain their favor. Players will have to pool resources with their opponents to gather enough influence to succeed in the audiences and gain. The player who has gathered the most after 7 rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Core Worlds: Nemesis
boardgame.description:
Core Worlds: Nemesis is the official solo version of the Core Worlds deck-building game. Play against the AI-driven Nemesis Empire during your bid to conquer the Core Worlds. The Nemesis is represented by a special deck of cards that simulates play against a human player, including anticipating which worlds the Nemesis is targeting in each sector and which Core Worlds the Nemesis is planning to conquer as it drafts cards throughout the game.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: 073 – The Evolution of Deckbuilding with Andrew Parks, Designer of Core Worlds

boardgame.name: Bliss
boardgame.description:
A worker placement and engine building-game about living a good life, with fully customizable personalities (more than 100,000 possible combinations).

This card-based worker placement game starts with you creating your own unique personality. Your personality consists of:

Nature: A long-term ability you have for the entire game
Nurture: A change to your character's starting stats
Habit: A special ability you can use once per round
Goals: A list of tasks that give you victory points each round if you achieve them


Each of these cards is double-sided, so after being dealt four of them randomly, you choose which sides of each card to use in order to mix and match them to create your own unique personality. For example, with one set of four cards you could be:

An ignorant wealthy narcissist who has a habit of taking mental health days
A wise, but heavily in debt, narcoleptic who enjoys working with close friends
Or any combination of the above


Once the game begins, players simultaneously choose actions using time as a resource, carefully selecting which opportunities will benefit them the most. Using these opportunities, players will influence their wealth, future opportunities, or emotional state, to build an engine that will result in the most Bliss by the end of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Raccoon Lagoon
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
In Raccoon Lagoon you are a helpful Island Spirit whose purpose is to help the marooned sailors known as the Nyms build and thrive on the island. It’s up to you how you help them, but rest assured, the Nyms are not shy about telling you what they need! As you help the Nyms, you will find yourself exploring all over the island and helping them with activities like Fishing, Farming, Mining and Cooking. If you feel overwhelmed you can even ask a friend to come help and join your island. Don’t forget to return the favor and help them with theirs!

boardgame.name: Astrocracy
boardgame.description:
Astrocracy is a socio-political sci-fi game for 3-6 players. It is a competitive, deck building, worker placement, resource management game, where players act as the leader of a galactic nation, seeking to guide humanity in a common direction. Players draft from Ideological Stances that represent the culture of their nation. The combination of Stances selected determines a player’s starting Draw deck. Once the game begins, players will assign their Population to work their planets, yielding the planet’s resources. Players will then Draw their cards and take their actions, such as constructing androids, trading with other players, patronizing Great People, discovering Technologies, Surveying new worlds. Other phases include feeding your people, voting on galactic policies, tracking the happiness of your people, and much more.

—Rick Wolford, game's designer

boardgame.name: The Bestiary of Cryptofauna
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like in every other aspect of life, when summoning ideas for fantasy role-playing games, there is always room for new original ideas and pushing of the boundaries of your very own monster inventory.

The author's own imagination manages to invoke 41 new and returning monsters, some of which are mere expansions of existing classic fantasy monsters, others belonging to relatively almost untapped world mythologies, and others are obscure yet fascinating long-lost extinct megafauna. This monster book includes creatures both benign and malicious, or rather neutral.

boardgame.name: Ranger Archetype: Treasure Hunter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Though several thieves fancy themselves to be in legitimate pursuits of treasure, the truest Treasure Hunters are devoted to the recovery of legendary Artifacts. A Treasure Hunter’s reasoning for this quest will vary from person to person, but all approach their legendary quarry with the utmost fervor and commitment.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a ranger character, rangers of the Treasure Hunter archetype are questants in search of the most powerful of magical items - Artifacts. In pursuit of these artifacts, they'll learn new ways to use magical items truly become the stuff of legends. Furthermore, this PDF contains a sidebar with some typical narrative constructs for Game Masters to consider in quests revolving around artifacts.

boardgame.name: めつたけ (Metsutake)
滅茸 (Metsutake)
boardgame.description:
滅茸 (Metsutake) is a bluffing card game from Japan about growing mushrooms.

Players try to grow and eat the best mushroom, but people risk falling ill if they eat the wrong kind of mushrooms. The players are encouraged to eat wild mushrooms over those grown in farms. If they happen to feed poisonous mushrooms to other players, well accidents happen.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Soya Okamura (オカムラ ソーヤ)

boardgame.name: Improved Familiars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this File, improved familiars! Predesigned for your convenience, these exciting new options allow your spellcasting characters to join forces with the likes of quasits, cassissians, nosoi, pipefoxes, and more!

boardgame.name: The Palace of Ballogfar Part II (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a setting / campaign this big, one Small Bite is not enough! It’s time to continue The Lost City of Ballogfar, so, here is Part II. This place is big! How big? How about a dungeon style adventure that is 15 miles by 8 miles.

What fills that enormous amount of space? Well, it is a massive ruin that has been taken over by the wild plants and animals of the region, including many that are not only wild, but are also fantastical - dragons, drakes, wyrms, and a lot of other stuff that isn’t part of dragonkind. But there are a lot of ogres! Not only are there ogres about, but there are factions of ogres. Some have been here the whole time, while others are coming in from the outside world, exploring the ruin themselves. There are also a lot of undead, because they can survive the centuries between the collapse and the now ruin.

But this edition is primarily about those ogre factions. Maybe ogres in your world are simple, stupid creatures and they cannot show any differences. We have a slightly better opinion of them. But sure, some of them are big, dumb monsters, but some of them have just enough smarts to band together, to use what their ancestors left them, and to scrounge what was not intended to be left to them. There are hunters, raiders, thugs, and even cannibals. You might see these factions as tribes, but whatever name you put on them, groups can work together.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. This time the theme is Ogres. While it is primarily focused on The Lost City of Ballogfar, it also includes ogres that are from Ogre Country, meaning outside the ruins and how they interact with their human and dwarven neighbors. We expect that these specific and generic examples will give you enough ideas that should spark your imagination.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that whether you are a veteran or a starter, a player or a game master, you are all going to find things you can use - ideas to spark characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

This supplement contains 26 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 130 pages. If you haven’t taken a look at our Small Bites before, this is the perfect opportunity to give us a try!

boardgame.name: We're All Fiends Here
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 5-6

Over the last several years a group of fiends have been desecrating a once hallowed church. Their goal is to summon their master and gift her a corrupted relic stored behind sealed doors.

The withered old church is nothing but a husk, the interior long since abandoned. The once well-polished floors have given in to years of rot and now reveal a set of stone stairs leading down.

boardgame.name: Tower of Fear and Flame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of level 4

Solitude breeds eccentricity, so nobody batted an eye when the local artificer-wizard Felicitrus started asking everyone he met about their fears, nor did anyone question his increasingly hostile and paranoid inquiries into the veracity of the replies.

The locals became concerned when Felicitrus started talking to the flames in the tavern’s hearth during his weekly binge. This weird behavior culminated last month, when the wizard suddenly jumped up from his seat next to the tavern’s fireplace and ran to his tower, a rictus of absolute terror distorting his face. The doors slammed shut behind him. No one has heard from the wizard since.

boardgame.name: Vigilante
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Vigilante is a roguish archetype that pays homages to heroes and anti-heroes who skulk in the shadows, protecting their turf when they feel the authorities cannot. They utilize darkness, fear and debilitating strikes to bring down their targets.

boardgame.name: The Bruja, The Beast, and The Barrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Curse and disease are endemic ailments of the adventuring life, and finding reliable treatment is never an easy task in the wastelands of the Crystal Frontier, but Marble Eye, the witch of Pickbone Mound is said to have the panacea for everything. He’ll take all your hard earned plunder, but like all witches the canny old bale worker would rather make a deal and there’s something in the tombs beneath his cursed hut that needs attention.

Endure the necessity of dubious pacts with Marble Eye the exiled Bruja...
Recoil at the monstrous might of the Beast…
Brave the ancient wards of the cursed Barrow…

A four page mini-adventure designed modern interations and retroclones of fantasy role playing’s earliest systems.

boardgame.name: Star Spire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The desert night is shattered by the fall of a crystal shard, a sky tomb filled with treasures from beyond the fixed stars and ready to plunder.

MARVEL at the astronomer’s Stellar Shrine!
SHIVER at the sinister dance of the Glass Spiders!
DELIGHT at the whimsy of the Housekeeping Automata!

A complete two page mini-adventure for the upcoming Tomb Robbers of the Crystal Frontier, but ready to drop into almost any fantasy setting, stated for the wayward offspring of older editions of the first roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Bigby's Handbook of Creative Spell Use
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bigby’s Handbook of Creative Spell Use is a supplement full of creative spell use, combos and character synergies for your game.

boardgame.name: Mission ISS
boardgame.description:
The International Space Station (ISS) is a joint project in which sixteen countries are currently involved. The ISS is a symbol of what people can achieve by working together. Boundaries that seem so important on Earth take a back seat on the space station; what matters is a perfectly coordinated collaboration between the astronauts.

Mission ISS begins in 1998 when the first module of the ISS was built. From your control center, you give instructions to the astronauts in space. At first only a few crew members are on the station, but over time you bring more astronauts to the station to add new modules, carry out various research assignments, or just drift in weightlessness. As on the real space station, the co-operation between the players and the co-ordination of the astronauts determine the success of the ISS mission. Only together will you be able to master the challenge of space.

In more detail, the mechanism at the heart of the game requires deep co-operative play. To give instructions to astronauts, you combine two command cards: one of yours and one of your teammates. After you have performed the command effects, you place both cards on your own discard pile, which means that your turns always have an impact on the options of the other players. When you run out of cards, you take all cards from your discard pile to re-fill your display — but doing so brings the end of the game closer.

Up to six astronauts can be on the ISS. Each astronaut stands on a base with adjustable values for three types of abilities: drift to move, carry out researches, and add new modules. Train the astronauts to improve their abilities so that they can manage all of the challenges on the ISS.

Mission ISS Die Internationale Raumstation ISS ist ein gemeinsames Projekt an dem derzeit 16 Länder beteiligt sind. Die ISS ist ein Sinnbild dafür, was Menschen durch Zusammenarbeit erreichen können. Grenzen, die auf der Erde so wichtig erscheinen, treten auf der Raumstation in den Hintergrund. Worauf es ankommt, ist eine perfekt abgestimmte Zusammenarbeit der Astronauten. Das Spiel beginnt im Jahr 1998, in dem das erste Modul der ISS aufgebaut wurde. Aus eurem Kontrollzentrum gebt ihr den Astronauten im Weltall Anweisungen. Zunächst befinden sich nur wenige Besatzungsmitglieder auf der Station. Im Laufe des Spiels, bringt ihr jedoch weitere Astronauten auf die Station, die dort neue Module anbauen, verschiedene Forschungsaufträge erledigen oder sich einfach mal in der Schwerelosigkeit treiben lassen. Wie auf der realen Raumstation, entscheidet die Kooperation zwischen den Spielern und die Koordination der Astronauten über den Erfolg der Mission ISS. Nur gemeinsam werdet ihr die Herausforderung des Weltalls meistern können.

boardgame.name: The Sleeper Rising
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

In Act 1: The Sleeper Rising, you and your fellow heroes are caught between the religious police and a cabal of hidden cultists. Recruited by the king of Axphain, you must begin to root out the cultists. You discover a network of tunnels converging on the Royal Place, which leads to high-stakes intrigue and investigation.

At the King’s masquerade ball, an eldritch horror is unleashed, and the ultimate abomination rises above the city! Yet, this is only the beginning – volume 1 of The Big Sleep – an entire campaign devoted to exploring the terrors and wonders of the Great Old One Tsathoggua – the Sleeper.

boardgame.name: Simon's Cat: Dinner Date
Simons Katze: Verflixte Vögel
boardgame.description:
In Simon's Cat: Dinner Date, the deck is composed of pictures with birds and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row. The first player to find the right bird and point to it gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Dobbel Vouwen
Hop c'est Plié !
Kannste Knicken
boardgame.description:
In Kannste Knicken ("Can bend"), everyone plays at the same time, marking off spaces of their choice on their individual player sheet based on the roll of two special dice each turn.

You can fold over a corner of your paper, but only after marking all of the smiley faces in that corner. But will you fold over the corner just a little bit or much more? You need to mark off more smiley faces to "bend" more of the paper, but you receive a permanent bonus each time that you do.

Whoever first bends all four corners on their player sheet, then connects the revealed target symbols on their sheet wins.

Kannste Knicken includes four types of player sheets with differing degrees of difficulty.

Die Tavernen im Tiefen Thal: Zimmer frei!, 1. Erweiterung Unser Dort soll noch schöner werden! Noch vor wenigen Jahren kannte kaum jemand das Tiefe Thal. Heute schon besuchen Adelige in Scharen unser schönes Örtchen. Trotzdem konnten wir unseren ursprünglichen Charme erhalten. Aber ich sage euch, meine lieben Wirte und Mitbürger: Wir werden noch einen oben drauf setzen! Wir werden den Wein aus der Region berühmt machen und unseren Gästen die feinsten Zimmer bieten. Ich werde die Wirte höchstpersönlich bei ihren Bemühungen unterstützen. Ganze Reisekutschen voll Besuchern werden zu uns strömen.. Das - meine lieben Freunde - ist meine Vision für mein für unser Tiefen Thal!
Mit den 4 neuen Modulen in dieser Erweiterung, erhalten die Spieler die Möglichkeit einen Weinkeller und Gästezimmer anzubauen. Durch die Wirte bekommen Spieler individuelle Fähigkeiten, die die Strategie im Spiel beeinflussen und es winken Belohnungen vom Bürgermeister, wenn ihr ihm helft „sein“ Tiefen Thal zum Tourismuszentrum auszubauen.
Nur zusammen mit dem Grundspiel: Die Taverne im Tiefen Thal spielbar!
✓ Erweiterung ✓ Familienspiel/ Brettspiel ✓ Kennerspiel ✓ Genre -Taktik & Glück

boardgame.name: Pot Smugglin' Blues
boardgame.description:
POT SMUGGLIN' BLUES consists of a board map of the Caribbean, a spinner that drives the game, four HOT WHEELS that locate weather conditions and police hot spots, and four sets of CARDS that determine weather conditions, mechanical difficulties and other fortunes & (Mis)Fortunes. Your goal is to sail your load of marijuana to a North American port and payola.

Except when you are safely in a North American port, every move begins by spinning the spinner. Each number on the spinner also contains 6 colors.

When a player spins, the number and color landed on not only select the load amount offered and country of origin, they also rotate one of the Hot Wheels. The number spun tells you how far to move your sailboat or determines when you've encountered Mechanical Difficulties or a (Mis)Fortune. The compass direction you've spun sets the wind direction.

>- Decide who goes first and have each player select a colored boat stand.
>- Everyone's first spin determines their load's quantity, quality, and country origin. The number spun is the number of thousands of pounds you are smuggling (2 on the spinner means 2,000 pounds). When you decide to take a load, borrow your stake, and place the appropriate sail, depicting the country of origin and the quantity of pot, onto your boat.

You will face challenges with rough weather, mechanical difficulties, avoiding the US Coast Guard, getting through US Customs, and the Bermuda Triangle.

The Pot Smugglin' Blues board game is drawn from true-life experiences of a bygone era. Will Berger’s true-life experiences. Practically everything that can happen playing the game actually did happen to Will Berger while sailing the Caribbean back in the 1980's. In those precartel, pre-terrorist days, smuggling marijuana was considered romantic adventure, not to mention a fantastic way to create great stacks of fast cash, and in the process encounter informers and snitches, get busted, lose all your money and go to jail with the blues. All of which conspires to make the Pot Smugglin' Blues game suspenseful, emotion-filled escapism.

So what are you waiting for? Load your sailboat with the good herb, plot your course north for a safe passage, hoist sails and find your wind, get out the star charts and see the Southern Cross for the first time, deliver the weed to the promised land and reap millions of dollars for your success. Do it now-- when they legalize pot, the thrill will be gone. Smooth sailing!

boardgame.name: nickname
ニックネーム
닉네임
boardgame.description:
Call by some NICKNAME and ask for a Item card. It's fun when you meet someone for the first time.
"nickname" was born out of the thoughts of middle school girl "Nanana Kudo".

[Rules]
Pick any player who seems to have the card you want and collect it by guessing.
This is a game where you collect four Item cards from the same nickname group.

Close to rules called Author, Quartet


When you ask for help, you call any your opposition under they's first name such as "Doctor", "Teacher", "Leader" and "C.E.O." which are written on a Item card that you want.

"DR. Albert, can I have a FLASK?"
"TEACHER John, give me a TEXTBOOK. Please."
"C.E.O. Steve, Can I borrow your LUXURY CAR?"

That's how each of you call each other in different ways during the game.
And the player with the most nickname groups wins.

boardgame.name: Zombie Circus Goats
boardgame.description:
Zombie Circus Goats is a 2-4 player game. In it players start with three cards and then, in turn order, draw a single card. Players may play talent cards and then roll dice to collect gold, brains, blood or guts cards based on their talent and roll.

The game includes a trading mechanism where players can trade talent cards with one another. The winner is the first player to amass 5 zombie circus goat cards.

—user summary

Zombie Circus Goats is the strategic new card game about everyone's favorite things: Zombies, Goblins, Goats, and Shouting.

Build your troupe. Steal your friends' Goats. Howl in victory!

WARNING: Contains Hellephants, Two-Headed Boys, Robotic Bees, Weregartners, Ma'ampires, Rabbits w/ lightsabers, Meerkats, Tiny Sasquatch, Arrogant Octopuses...and a whole bunch of Zombies.

Get Paid in Body Parts.

Shout in Bad Accents.

Cast Weird Spells at Your Friends.

Make Felicia Fetch You a Drink.

For 2-6 live players. 30-90 minutes adjustable playtime. Host nights of howling infamy.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Avec Infini Regret III: Moncontour 1569
boardgame.description:
Avec Infini Regret III - French Wars of Religion, 1562 - 1598
The battle of Moncontour, 1569

The Peace of Longjumeau, signed on 23 March 1568, ended the second Wars of Religion but was fragile. The royal power no longer trusted the prince of Condé, leader of the Protestant party. A few months after the signing, the Catholics attempted to capture the prince of Condé and Admiral Coligny by surprise. The plot failed and the Protestant commanders reassembled with their armies and took refuge at La Rochelle.
Thus began the campaign constituting the third War of Religion at the end of the summer of 1568. The objective of the Royal Army, commanded by the Duc of Anjou, future king Henry III, was to seize the Protestant towns between Charente and Dordogne. After a winter campaign marked by desertions on both sides, the Duc of Anjou claimed victory on 13 March 1569 at Jarnac when the prince of Condé was cut down in cold blood while surrendering to a Catholic nobleman. Coligny succeeded him as commander of the Huguenot army. Despite this victory, Anjou was unsuccessful in capturing the city of Cognac. Furthermore, he didn’t have enough troops to supply a garrison in the cities seized from the Protestants.
On 25 June 1569, Admiral de Coligny took his revenge and defeated the Catholics at La Roche-L’Abeille where Strozzi, colonel general of the royal infantry, was taken prisoner. He then lay siege to Poitiers but was forced to abandon it after several weeks in order to confront the Catholic troops preparing to him from his rear bases.

On 3 October 1569, the two armies faced off near Moncontour.Gaspard de Coligny did not want to engage in battle, knowing he was outnumbered. However, German mercenaries among his troops were unhappy at not being paid and precipitated the movement. The Catholic troops were better prepared, greater in number and more heavily armed and easily pushed back the assault of the Protestants who were forced into a disorderly retreat.
Although it barely lasted two hours, this battle resulted in between 6000 and 10.000 men dead or taken prisoner on the side of the Protestants compared to 1000 for the Catholics. The Swiss soldiers of the Royal Army spared no lansquenet in retaliation for La Roche-L’Abeille

Game components:
• Two 59 x 41 cm maps (one printed front and back)
• 216 die-cut counters and markers
• 1 rule book including scenarios
• 1 color player aid

-description from publisher's website

RCW 1: Real World Consequences
Warning: There are Goblins
Zombies Invade the Moon
The Zombie Pizza! Token
NSFW 1: The Offendening Expansion Pack
NSFW 2: Fine, I'm Leaving Expansion Pack

Zombie Circus Goats: +2 Players Expansion Pack

Zombie Circus Goats: NSFW 2 – Fine, I'm Leaving Expansion Pack

Zombie Circus Goats: Warning – There are Goblins Expansion Pack
Zombie Circus Goats: Zombies Invade the Moon Expansion Pack

boardgame.name: All Sheeps and Sizes
boardgame.description:
You are an award-winning shepherd getting ready to win the annual Wool and Fleece competition. And this year, you are hunting for the best and shiniest sheep - but so are your fellow competitors. Be prepared to use all sheeps and sizes to claim victory.

All Sheeps and Sizes is a strategic card game about sheep. You want to get high scoring sheep into your sheep pen to give you points. The game ends when all the cards in the deck run out. If you have the most points at the end of the game, you win!

Your sheep pen is like your hand because it is where you keep and play all your cards from. But all the cards in your sheep pen are placed face down and you can't look at them so you will have to remember which card is which so that you can play the right cards.

Some of the cards in the game give you points. But the Wolf card reduces your points, so you want to make sure you don't have the wolf at the end of the game. The other cards have special effects to be used during the game, like viewing, swapping, stealing and destroying other cards. Use your cards effectively to win!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trinity of Reign
boardgame.description:
In Trinity of Reign you take over the rule of one of the four clans and build your empire. Construct cities, castles and metropolises. Lead your capital to fame and power through rapid expansion. Recruit new warriors and send out your druids to develop new potions and consolidate your rule. Choose your path. Take reign either by creating wealth, by invoking the gods, or by conquering land.

Trinity of Reign is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players is aimed at casual to professional players. Easy to learn, it offers countless strategic possibilities and ways of playing. The detailed building miniatures and the possibility of individual expansion of the capital let you create a unique little world in every game, but you can never be completely sure of its integrity.

Win the game by one of the following three variants:

By military conquest of two complete regions (12 provinces, the military victory can be obtained.
By building the Hall of Ancestors in the capital, the wealth victory can be won.
By preparing the potion of the highest god Taranis and using it by a druid, the religion victory can be achieved.


If no player achieves one of the above victory conditions within the maximum nine rounds, the game ends with a points victory for the player with the most points.

Each round contains of four different phases. It starts with the Earnings, where each player receives the tax revenue and mines his resources. Next comes the Actions of Druids, where the druids can collect ingredients, prepare potions or do other special actions. With the potions, they brew, you can unlock new special abilities for your druids. Then, in the Buying phase, any desired buildings, capital expansions, or units can be purchased. The capital expansions will give you special Bonis, towns or metropolises in the province, give you more tax income and with new troops you can conquer your opponents or protect your country from foreign invaders. In the Place, Move & Fight phase, the acquired buildings or units are then placed on the map, then you can move your troops and solve battles if they occur.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Fleet: The Dice Game (Second Edition)
Флот. Улов Кубов
boardgame.description:
The English second edition features an updated rulebook, scorepads and the captain & trophy cards.


About the game:Fleet: The Dice Game is an exciting new strategic roll and write dice game from the creators of Fleet! Fleet: The Dice Game is heavier than many roll and write games and captures the tense, meaningful decisions of Fleet. Fleet: The Dice Game is for 1-4 players.

In Fleet: The Dice Game, you are back in beautiful Ridback Bay to reap its rewards! Fleet: The Dice Game takes place over 10 rounds with each round having two phases, the Boat Phase and the Town Phase.

In the boat phase, the active player rolls players plus one boat dice. In turn order, each player selects one die to use immediately. By selecting a boat die, they get to check off the matching boat type on their sheet - unlocking license powers and boat launches to catch fish. The die that remains after all players have selected is then used by all players.

In the town phase, you roll town dice equal to players plus one boat die. Again, in turn order each player selects one die to use immediately. In the town phase, you unlock special buildings in the Wharf that grant bonuses, awesome ships in the harbor to earn points and catch more fish, or go to the market and gain income to generate bonus actions. The die that remains after all players have selected is then used by all players.

Fishing occurs between phases in the even rounds and the player with the most points at game end wins!

Fleet: The Dice Game also features a fully integrated solo mode where you battle Captain Ruth to earn the most points and reap the rewards of Ridback Bay.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 73: Special Guest - Ryan Courtney! Plus The Cost, Kanban EV, Darwin's Journey
